title: Arsenal vs PSG LIVE : Champions League latest score and confirmed lineups | Football
body_text:
Ousmane Dembele scored the only goal as Paris Saint-Germain outclassed Arsenal in the first leg of their Champions League semi-final.
PSG took the lead on four minutes with Dembele starting and finishing the move – driving through the middle and finding Khvicha Kvaratskhelia – who cut the ball back for his unmarked teammate to fire in a first-time shot.
Mikel Merino thought he’d levelled things up for Arsenal early into the second half after glancing his header into the bottom corner from a superb Declan Rice free-kick but it was rightly chalked off by VAR for offside.
Chances for both sides came and went with Gianluigi Donnarumma producing a remarkable save to deny Leandro Trossard before Goncalo Ramos hit the crossbar for the visitors but no more goals followed.
It means Arsenal will now head into the Champions League semi-final second leg in Paris 1-0 behind when the sides meet again on May 7.
Here’s how it unfolded…
Live Feed
This Live Blog has now ended
This blog is now closed. For the latest updates, visit Metro’s Football page.
That’s all from us!
Thanks for joining our live blog tonight.
Arsenal are 1-0 behind in their Champions League semi-final – but as David Raya just said – it’s only half-time…
The Gunners travel to Paris for the second leg against PSG next week.
Stay with Metro for all the latest reaction – and be sure to pick up a copy of our paper tomorrow!
‘We could have won the game as well’
Emirates atmosphere lacking?
PSG star Vitinha wins Man of the Match
A solid performance from PSG star Vitinha, it must be said…
‘PSG did what I expected Arsenal to do!’
Former AC Milan star Clarence Seedorf, on Amazon Prime punditry duties, just said: ‘For Arsenal to really elevate to that winning team, they have to shift in mentality.
‘PSG did what I expected Arsenal to do. They pressed high.’
FULL TIME: Arsenal 0-1 PSG
PSG get the job done in north London – but it’s all to play for in the second leg…
Odegaard off
Nwaneri comes on for Odegaard. Not long to go now.
Five minutes added on
It’s now or never for Arsenal – or they’re heading to Paris for the second leg 1-0 behind.
PSG still lead by one goal here at the Emirates. Five minutes added.
Third change for the visitors
PSG take off Neves – he’s replaced by Zaire-Emery. 89 minutes played here.
PSG hit the crossbar!
Yep – PSG are firmly pushing for the second now… Ramos has just hit the crossbar. Arsenal lucky not to concede again.
Huge chance for Barcola!
Oh wow… PSG could – and probably should – be 2-0 up there. It’s a big chance for Barcola but he can’t convert.
It remains 1-0 to PSG at the Emirates. 85 minutes played.
White comes on for Arsenal
Arteta makes his first substitution on 83 minutes. White comes on with Timber heading for the bench.
Chance for Neves!
Neves shoots but the PSG man blazes it over the bar. A warning for Arsenal there…
Chance for Saka!
Saka sees a shot saved by Donnarumma – but it wouldn’t have counted anyway as the flag goes up. That got the crowd going again a bit…
PSG make second change
Doue off. Ramos on.
Arteta attempts to get the crowd going
Arteta has just been throwing up his arms in an attempt to get the crowd going. It’s all gone a bit quiet in north London…
PSG take Dembele off
First substitution of the match. PSG boss Enrique decides to replace goalscorer Dembele with Barcola on 70 minutes.
‘PSG comfortable in possession’
Clinton Morrison, watching the match for Sky Sports, just said: ‘Every player at PSG is comfortable in possession.
‘Arsenal have just got to keep believing at the moment. They’re still in it. Arsenal just need a goal.’
‘Crucial time in the game for Arsenal’
Alan Shearer, on commentary duties for Amazon Prime, just said: ‘This is a crucial time in the game for Arsenal.
‘You can see that PSG are trying to slow the tempo and kill the crowd even more.’
PSG lead 1-0 with 67 minutes played.
Arsenal still behind on the hour mark
We’ve played 60 minutes and Arsenal are still behind…
